User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686) AppleWebKit/534.24 (KHTML, like Gecko) Ubuntu/11.04 Chromium/11.0.696.57 Chrome/11.0.696.57 Safari/534.24
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0.1

If any of the defaults for the following settings are changed, the "Firefox will:" dropdown under Preferences -> Privacy -> History will display "Remember History" even though it should say "Use custom settings for history."
   - places.history.enabled
   - browser.download.manager.retention
   - browser.formfill.enable
   - network.cookie.cookieBehavior
   - network.cookie.lifetimePolicy
   - privacy.sanitize.sanitizeOnShutdown

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
0. Let $FIREFOXINSTALL be the directory in which the firefox executable is contained.

1. In $FIREFOXINSTALL/ create a file called mozilla.cfg containing the text (the two slashes at the beginning are important):
//
lockPref("network.cookie.lifetimePolicy", 2);
lockPref("network.cookie.cookieBehavior", 1);

2. In $FIREFOXINSTALL/defaults/pref create a file called locks.js containing the text:

pref("general.config.obscure_value", 0);
pref("general.config.filename", "mozilla.cfg");

3. Make sure both files are readable by everyone.

Actual Results:  
After starting Firefox and opening the Privacy tab in the Preferences dialog, "Firefox will remember history" was selected, even though the cookies were set to delete when Firefox was closed and third-party cookies were rejected.  This could be verified in about:config, which would show both settings locked and not set to 0 (the default, default value).

Expected Results:  
Preferences -> Privacy -> History should say "Use custom settings for history" with the correct settings selected.

This bug does not make firefox behave incorrectly.  The settings are obeyed, but simply displayed incorrectly.
